title: @Meddler: Do you guys have any idea of the direction of his future VGU?
body:
In the ChampUp notes, it was stated that Shaco would receive some love taps until the time for his VGU came around. Is there any idea of the direction you want him to go?

From the little fragments we could get, I think the 2 things that we can sort off confirm is that you want to double down on his trickery aspect (no more box stacking, but longer duration / illuminati triangle on ult) and the fact that you don't want Shaco to have Lane Poke (making his E much weaker early game / in the former Shaco VGU project making him turn in the dagger he throws - possibly overriding the function of his current E and turning it into an engage). Are those 2 guesses right? Is there anything else that can be said?


Signed,
A random curious Shaco main.

replies.body: We don't have any particular plans, or a set time, for a Shaco VGU. I'd expect we'd want to keep, or enhance, his identity as a deception and trick heavy assassin though certainly. We've got a pretty sizeable list of champions we're predicting we'll VGU before Shaco though, which was one of the reasons we wanted to try and work on him in the pre-season just gone.
Is it possible to get an UNOFFICIAL upcoming VGU list showing champs you'd wanna tackle in an order starting with most liklely/ needed?

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hb2gEfA,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-26T18:49:14.632+0000)
>
> We don't have any particular plans, or a set time, for a Shaco VGU. I'd expect we'd want to keep, or enhance, his identity as a deception and trick heavy assassin though certainly. We've got a pretty sizeable list of champions we're predicting we'll VGU before Shaco though, which was one of the reasons we wanted to try and work on him in the pre-season just gone.

So It's been 2 years now, any updates on this?

I'm happy that he will eventually double down on the trickster side, instead of the Diver-ish identity. But yeah, I wouldn't really expect him being anywhere near the top of the list seeing as he just received a band-aid and is at an ok-ish position balance-wise.

Ohh btw, is there any possibility of a bone thrown to his Full AD build or is it already performing well again? Last I've heard it was at a 40%-ish I believe.


~~MEDDLER NOTICED ME!! Fanboys away~~
You shouldn't be playing him FULL AD imo, theres so many nice aspects of his kit that scale of AP that its just so hard to pass up. And more over than anything AP shaco is best shaco.

Shaco has been an (mostly) AD champion since his release. And his AD variant is still loved by many of his mains, specially the ones who've mained him long before the update came through. Mostly because AD Shaco is able to control objectives and push much better than his AP variant, at the expense of some killing power and powerful traps.

One of the most unique aspects of Shaco is that he's able to build however he wants: AP, AD, Bruiser, Full Tank, CDR. It's all viable and there is no reason why take away a playstyle from the champion if it won't hurt the others.

once you get lichbane, you can  chunk towers and since they changed the way ap scaling works against towers, having a clone dealing damage to towers is just as fast, if not faster than AD.

(noted that AP doesn't build attack speed, so you would win a push contest as AD shaco) But this doesn't seem to be the goal of playing shaco anymore, at least in my opinion.

Split pushing and controling objectives were never Shaco's *goal*, but merely a fallback pattern if for one reason or another he's unnable to be a killing machine. AP Shaco might even be decent at chunking towers (given that they are made of wet paper right now), but good luck at pushing through minion waves to reach the tower. Not to mention that he's 100% unnable to do it if the enemy team uses a {{item:3512}} or {{item:3060}} on the lane.

AP Shaco is indeed better than AD Shaco at taking 1 target down, but for everything else AD Shaco has an advantage due to how versatile AD is in comparassion to AP in general.

None of the above problems are a problem for me, i build protobelt first, its a 40s cooldown and i can choose to push a tower by 1 shotting a minion wave or saving it against a champion.

Killing buffed up minions aren't a problem either since later on in the game q hits for 1000 against minions when u have lich bane, and E executes them.

Also, ap shaco is best for teamfights because of how explosive he is. I can set up for barons / dragons and if they dive to steal or just try forcing a fight, i can box off the entrances so they take heavy damage.

AD shaco can't do that, all you can do with AD is be an auto attack machine.

> None of the above problems are a problem for me, i build protobelt first, its a 40s cooldown and i can choose to push a tower by 1 shotting a minion wave or saving it against a champion.

AP Shaco can take down one wave every 40 seconds with {{item:3152}}. 
AD Shaco can take down every wave in a row with his core {{item:3077}} + {{item:3087}}.

> Killing buffed up minions aren't a problem either since later on in the game q hits for 1000 against minions when u have lich bane, and E executes them.

{{item:3060}} gives minions immunity to magic damage. All AP Shaco has against it is 117*1.45 damage every 3 secs. Q will deal a hefty amount of damage, but it won't proc {{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} due to it's immunity to magic damage. So to deal that 1k damage, you'll need over 1k AP (about 1.2K to be more precise). And even with 1.2K AP, it won't be enough to 1 shot a Promoted Cannon Minion, meaning that you'd need 2 Q to take it down. That's 23 seconds without your Q while split pushing. Doesn't get riskier than this. And AP Shaco can obviously forget about that E execute  against them.

> Also, ap shaco is best for teamfights because of how explosive he is.

Granted, AP Shaco is indeed better than AD Shaco for team fights right now. Although I'd argue Tanky On-Hit Shaco takes the Team Fight cake right now.

> I can set up for barons / dragons and if they dive to steal or just try forcing a fight, i can box off the entrances so they take heavy damage.

{{item:2055}} {{item:3364}}
Not to mention that AP Shaco deals about zero damage to Baron and Drake. Nevermind solo'ing them.


Seriously, AP Shaco is extremely good at killing things (which is an Assassin's main purpose) and provides some really welcome AoE damage for team fights, but aside from that, there's no denying that AD Shaco does everything else better. The wave clear is more consistent, the damage to structures is higher, the control over neutral objectives is uncomparable.

I just wish there was a way to get a middle ground for both builds in which Shaco had a decent Team Fight power (but maybe not as abusive as it was post update) and still have a fallback pattern.

Q damage is phys. I seriously doubt that you've played AP shaco to its fullest potential because of the way you describe it...

Check out my op.gg and you'll see 80% win rate isn't a joke.

I know how the Q damage works. That's where the 1.2k AP to deal 1k damage was coming from.

I'm not denying that AP Shaco is the most efficient build *right now* (and that's why I've asked about the AD build) and I've abused it a bit in my other account. I just don't enoy it because of how simple the AP playstyle is. I've mained AD Shaco since 2011 and I can assure you that it's MUCH more versatile.

Ask any Shaco main (and I mean a real main, not someone who started to use him as Freelo after the update) if you doubt it. They will all admit that AP Shaco always had it's pros over AD, but that AD is the versatile build.

if the first hits the back he gets a reset on his Q, maybe he adds a turn speed to make it easier to line up the second shot 

if the second hits then it does execute damage

I'd be rather careful about giving Shaco a Q reset, specially on the first hit of a non-ultimate skill that will be coming out of stealth (aka almost impossible to dodge). 

Maybe if added to the second E alongside the execute it could be worked around, even without the cost of having to hit a backstab for it to reset. Another possibility would be to make it reduce part of it's CD, something like a 20% reduction on regular hit and 50% for a backstab, possibly on both parts.

That way it's not like a Shaco would just QE someone and Q away with no counterplay.
